quizInfo.Subject: Integrative Programming
quizInfo.Title: Data Types
References: Any external links/handouts should be referenced here

quizData.question: This is a name of a program component that is used to identify namespaces, classes, methods, etc. and is defined by the user.
Which of the following syntax rules in naming an identifier is FALSE ?
quizData.answer: The classes and methods in C# can begin with either an uppercase or lowercase letter.
choices: The classes and methods in C# can begin with either an uppercase or lowercase letter.
It must start with a letter of the English alphabet or an underscore character.
White spaces in the names are not allowed.

quizData.question: Based on the syntax rules of C#, which of the identifiers are NOT VALID?
These are words that a programming language use that possess a special predefined meaning and purpose to the compiler. The use of these words are not allowed and would cause a syntax error.
Which of the following words are not part of C#'s keywords?
This is an identifier and a memory location that stores a specific value.
Which of the following accurately depicts this description: A variable of data type integer named age with a value of 45.
When creating a program, the variable name must be meaningful and easy to understand its value.
Which of the following follows the Camel Case notation?
This is an identifier and a memory location whose value can't be changed during program execution.
Constants can have no value at the time of declaration.

Which of the following accurately depicts this description:
A constant of data type double named EARTHGRAVITY with a value of 9.8
The names of constants must be in all lowercase letters to make it easily identifiable.
These are used to specify a set of values and their operations associated with variables or constants.
This C# type of primitive data types store the value directly.
This C# type of primitive data types don't store the actual value in a variable or constant but instead store the reference where the value is actually stored.
The int data type is a value type.
The class objects, strings, and arrays are reference types.
A data type is a value type if it holds the data within its own memory allocation.
A data type is a reference type if it stores the address where the value is stored, meaning that the reference types contain the memory lcoation of where the value is stored.
This is the process of converting a value of 1 type of data to another data type, ensuring that a function correctly process the variables.
This is the conversion of a lower precision data type to a value of higher precision type.
This is the conversion allows the the user to convert a value of higher precision into a lower precision data type usig a cast operator.
A compiler doesn't automatically perform an implicit conversion if the precision of the data type is lower tha the precision of the preferred data type.

Which of the following accurately depicts this description:
Convert the value 25 of the byte variable named a into an integer data type named b.
There is no implicit conversion of any data type to char type.
The bool and double data types have no possible implicit conversion to other data types.
Explicit conversion involves the risk of losing information.

Which of the following accurately depicts this description:
The variable of data type double named price has a value of 75.5 which is then set as the value for the integer variable named varA.
choices:
double price = 75.5;
int varA = toInt price;

quizData.question: The explicit conversion of a data type to char will retrn the corresponding character of the value from the ASCII table.
